overview: "Buddha doesn't create any worries; therefore, we call him: Buddha. We, living beings keep creating worries; therefore, we are called: living beings." Everyone has worries: the woman in the shop has depression; the man is anxious about his job; the schoolgirl is nervous before a test. The modern world is busy, hectic and full of worries. In contrast, there is Buddhism, which aims to give order to worries and overcome them. Incidentally, a monk also has worries.
title: 108 Worries
